ai.summary: A 10.3 km moderate hike in the Runnymede area (UK), combining riverside paths, woodland trails, and access to historic memorial sites. Ideal for walkers with a bit of experience who want a quiet route with reflective scenery.
ai.terrain_summary: The route uses a mix of paved paths, gravel lanes, and short sections of uneven woodland trails. Expect occasional mud after rain and some gentle elevation changes. The riverbank sections can be uneven or slick when wet; choose sturdy footwear.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and daylight hours before setting out. Wear sturdy boots and carry water and a small snack. Stay on marked paths, especially near river edges and private grounds. Be mindful of cyclists and dog walkers on shared sections. Bring a map or GPS, and a phone with emergency contacts. In winter, allow extra time for mud and reduced traction.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing and a waterproof jacket
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (March–October) offer the best conditions, with longer daylight and milder weather; summer can be warm and busy at popular spots; winter hikes are possible but often wet and muddy.

seo.title: Memorial Route, Runnymede - 10.3 km Moderate Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore Memorial Route in Runnymede, UK: a 10.3 km moderate hike featuring riverside paths, woodlands, and historic memorial sites. Safety tips, gear, and best seasons.
